alert.note: Alert for Comal; Hays (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hays and northeastern Comal Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 427 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Canyon Lake Dam, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Braunfels, San Marcos, Wimberley, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Woodcreek, Mountain City, Hunter, Freiheit, Gruene, Hays City and Sattler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Texas.
